reasoning: The transcription details the process of preparing scallopini of chicken with zucchini. The steps are extracted based on the actions described by Jacques Pepin, such as cutting vegetables, seasoning, sauting, and cooking the chicken. Each step is identified by a change in the cooking process or the introduction of new ingredients or techniques.
dish_description: The dish is a scallopini of chicken with zucchini, which involves thinly sliced chicken breast cooked quickly with seasonings and served with a garnish of sauted zucchini strips. It is a simple yet elegant dish that serves two people.

cooking_steps.description: Start by preparing the zucchini: cut it into thin strips, also known as julienne, and discard the center if it has too many seeds.
Heat a couple of tablespoons of olive oil in a pan and saut the zucchini strips for a few minutes until they are cooked but still firm.
Season the zucchini with salt during the sauting process.
Cut the chicken breast into scallopini, which are long, thin slices, ensuring they are of even thickness.
Season the chicken scallopini with salt on both sides.
Sprinkle Spanish paprika on both sides of the chicken scallopini for added flavor.
In a separate pan, heat a good tablespoon of butter and a couple of teaspoons of oil, then add the chicken scallopini to the pan.
Cook the chicken for about a minute on each side, then add chopped shallots and cook for an additional minute or until the chicken is done.
